data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first minus the last four steps is 90 degrees. The five forward steps were all taken from the same direction as they came. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right after taking 4 steps then turn around.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the same as the last step we took. The starting point is the same as the end of the process. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

There is a 7 step sequence that starts with one step followed by 7 steps, then 1 step, and 7 step sequence with 7 steps and then 1 step. There is a 5 step sequence with 5 steps, followed by 2 steps, then 2 steps, and 2 steps with another step. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around: Take 15 steps back to the starting point.

Turn left and turn around. Turn around and turn right. Turn around and turn around. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you turn right, you are beginning to point back at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

While you are taking the first 6 steps, in order to turn around, you are taking 8 steps. So the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This phrase will return you to 1 step left. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
I don't know if 3 is a number or 2 is when taking steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The sentence "Take 1 step backward" is exactly as the exercise goes. "Take 1 step backward" is exactly as the exercise goes. So, the answer is yes.

People who are in a state of emergency would likely go to a rescue centre. We all know that being in a state of emergency doesn’t mean you return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, the starting point would be on the corner. You could always face forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
They say if you always face forward, it is in direct proportion to your forward motion and backward motion. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, it is easy to learn these steps. Take 6 steps left, and you return to starting point. So, the answer is No.

People can get to the starting point by turning 1 on the ground. One turns around and turns around. As you go around and turn left, you’ll take 4 steps. The first step is 4 and the last one is 10. So, the answer is No.

Take 10 steps first. Turn around. Take 3 steps then 6. Leave the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Turning around and turning right is the same as taking 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.

In the first instruction, you take 9 steps to go back to the starting point. In the second instruction, you take one step to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you turn right, the number of steps increases to 7. It may seem counter-intuitive that to take 7 steps you must take 5 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

There are four steps into the process: Take one step and turn right; Take 1 step; Take 3 steps; Turn left. If you follow the first order correctly, you would take 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If the person returns from the starting point, they must walk back to the starting point. If they do not turn around, the person will not be able to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Taking 3 steps + 7 steps = 14 steps. If you turn around, you can take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Do not walk backwards. If you take 7 steps left and 2 steps right you are taking 7 steps backwards. In a straight line, you can keep moving forward. When you take 7 steps, you are using your left hand to propel yourself forward on the path ahead. When you take 2 steps right, you are using your right hand to propel yourself forward on the path forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If one continually faces forward, one should always face the back. The beginning should be facing forward. Take 7 steps backward. The end should be facing left. So, the answer is no.

A turn is the process of turning to one side and back to another. A turn is the process of returning to one that you start from. So, the answer is yes.

The main thing to remember is to always come back to where you started to. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right. Take 5 steps. Make a U turn. Turn around. So, the answer is No.

A person begins a journey by facing forward. If you take 2 steps backward, you are done with the journey. If you take 3 steps backward, you are done with the journey. If you take 8 steps forward, you are done with the journey. So, the answer is No.

Turn around is the opposite position to start the turn. So, the answer is it is not possible to tell.

When facing forward with 6 steps forward, the only other option is to take 4 steps forward. If facing backward, the only other option is to take 9 steps backward. When facing forward with 4 steps, the only other option is to take 4 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Everyone always begins facing forward. If you go left, you go left. If you go right, you go right. The first step is always forward and the last step is backward. If you always turn your head back, you always take the right turns. If you always stare at someone, you always turn your right. The starting point is always facing forward. If you always face back, if you go straight and you start with your front feet, you take 10 steps reverse and you take 4 steps to your right. So, the answer is yes.
